path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/QuillAudits/Family Shark Safe Smart Contract Audit Report - QuillAudits.pdf

findings.title: Use the latest solidity version
findings.description: Using the latest solidity will prevent any compiler-level bugs.

findings.title: External instead of public
findings.description: If any function is not called from inside the smart contract, then it is better to declare it as external instead of public as it saves some gas as well.

findings.title: Missing zero address validation
findings.description: Variable validation is not performed in below functions : deliver, swapAndLiquify, setRouterAddress.

findings.title: Centralized risk in addLiquidity
findings.description: In addLiquidity function, owner() gets Tokens from the Pool. At some time, The owner will accumulate significant tokens. If the _owner is an EOA (Externally Owned Account), mishandling of its private key can have devastating consequences to the project.
